results.title: The Common cold
results.brief_description: Illustrates the facts known about the common cold, its care, and secondary infections that may grow out of it. Tells the story of a boy who contracts a cold and visits his doctor for treatment and advice. Reveals by means of the doctor’s illustrated explanation, why the common cold is serious and how it should be treated.

results.title: The Common cold
results.creator_credit: Informedia Productions (US), Canawest Films and Kelly Duncan
results.brief_description: Examines the worth or worthlessness of vaccines, antibiotics, vitamin C and other remedies for the common cold. Emphasises body resistance as the best protection. The structure and function of the virus which causes the cold is explained.

results.title: The Commitments
results.creator_credit: Sovereign Pictures, Roger Randall-Cutler, Lynda Myles and Allan Parker
results.brief_description: Alan Parker’s tale of an Irish working class band’s odyssey is a strident belt-you-in-the-mouth delight. On a mission to bring soul to Dublin plus fame and fortune for himself, Jimmy Rabbitte transforms a motley bunch of misfits and raw talent into ‘the hardest working band in the world’, THE COMMITMENTS, billing them as the ‘saviours of Soul’. Based on the cult novel by Roddy Doyle and set to a scorching soul soundtrack. This film pulsates with raw energy, colourful dialogue, working class struggles and big time dreams - it’s a knockout.

results.title: The Commissar = Kimissar
results.brief_description: Based on the novel “In the town of Berdichev” by Vassily Grossman. In the Ukraine in 1920 during the Russian Civil War, a weary commissar (political officer) finds that she is pregnant. The home of a poor Jewish tinker and his family is requisitioned for her confinement. Mutual suspicion gives way to warmer emotions. The commissar and her new baby become part of his extended family. With flashbacks, a surrealistic dream sequence and grim fantasy, the simple story is given a wider perspective as a meditation on Jewish suffering.

results.title: The Commandos
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson, Cine Service and Australia. Royal Air Force. Films Advisory Bureau
results.brief_description: Shows the tough training which makes CMF commandos: unarmed defence, cross-country fitness tests, cliff-climbing, parachute-jumping, canoeing and swimming. Includes an exercise in which commandos attach an “enemy strong-point” by sea and air.

results.title: The Coming of man
results.creator_credit: Vincent Serventy, Robert Raymond and Opus Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian ark”.
Aboriginal man is now known to have come to Australia at least 40,000 years ago, maybe even 50,000 years ago. Leading anthropologists, including Norman Tindale, John Mulvaney, Richard Wright and Bob Edwards explain their finds, including a 30,000 year old skull of a cremated woman at Lake Mungo, the Kow Swamp excavation of skeletons which resemble Java man, the 20,000 year old wall markings of the Koonalda Cave and the strange engraved stone faces of the Cleland Hills.

results.title: The Coming of darkness
results.brief_description: Seventh in a series of nine animated films on the history of Western Civilization. Discusses the two world wars and the events in Germany, Italy, China, Japan and Russia which were contributing factors. Contends that both were capitalist wars in which workers were fighting workers. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: The Comic Spirit (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A look at the different elements of comedy, performed and workshopped by the New Shakespeare Company from the Open Air Theatre in Regent’s Park. Shows sequences from modern comedy routines and relates these ideas of the comic genre to scenes from a number of Shakespearian comedies.

results.title: The Comeback
results.brief_description: Arnold Schwarzenegger, world champion bodybuilder, attempts a comeback after a lengthy retirement. The film reveals the motivated psychology of a winner in sport. The tension and excitement backstage at the Mr Olympia contest at the Sydney Opera House provides a compelling insight to a sport that is generally regarded as little more than a freak show. Also features Tom Platz and Frank Zane.

results.title: The Combat film
results.creator_credit: Danielle Gardner, Lawrence Pitkethly, BBC, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and New York Center for Visual History
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “American cinema”.
Beginning with World War II combat films which were produced under U.S. Federal Government directives, this program examines the role of the combat film in filling a social and political need. Critics and directors describe the evolution of these films, the rise of the Vietnam film and the influence of newsreel documentaries and television news on the genre.
